commit.message: egl-gbm: bump to version 1.1.1

egl-gbm: Return early for non-NVIDIA devices.

In eGbmGetPlatformDisplayExport, check the backend driver name, and
return early if that's not "nvidia".

If the gbm_device doesn't correspond to an NVIDIA device, then this lets
it return early, before calling eglQueryDevicesEXT. That's important on
multi-GPU systems, where calling eglQueryDevicesEXT might have to power
on an NVIDIA GPU, which wastes power and can be very slow.

egl-gbm: Use RTLD_DEFAULT when looking up mincore.

In eGbmPointerIsDereferenceable(), when calling dlsym to look up
mincore, use RTLD_DEFAULT instead of NULL.

Using NULL works on Linux because RTLD_DEFAULT is ((void *) 0). On
FreeBSD, though, RTLD_DEFAULT is not zero, so that dlsym call will fail.

Also updated meson.build to add -D_GNU_SOURCE to the compiler arguments.
EGL/GBM: avoid buffer overrun in eGbmChooseConfigHook

EGL/GBM: Close the leaking dmabuf fds

eGbmSurfaceLockFrontBuffer() function gets a dmabuf file descriptor from
ExportDMABUFImageMESA(), however this file descriptor is not closed
anywhere. This causes every call to gbm_surface_lock_front_buffer()
function to rack up dmabuf file descriptors in the running process,
while preventing reference counts of the related DRM GEM objects from
reaching zero. This problem manifested itself as a VRAM leak observed
when a connected monitor is power-cycled while running Wayland
compositors that use gbm_surface_lock_front_buffer() function while
handling this event.

This change adds a for-loop that iterates over the list of received file
descriptors and closes them when they are no longer needed.

EGL/GBM: Partially fix eGbmSurfaceHasFreeBuffers.

Add a counter for the number of free color buffers to GbmSurface. That
counter is initialized to the stream's FIFO length, decremented when we
acquire an EGLImage from the stream, and incremented when we release an
EGLImage.

Changed eGbmSurfaceHasFreeBuffers to return non-zero if the
GbmSurface::numFreeImages counter is non-zero.

Renamed GbmSurface::freeImages to acquiredImages, since that's the list
of EGLImages that we've acquired, and thus, the images that are *not*
free.

Note that the behavior of eglSwapBuffers is still wrong, and things will
break if an application tries to call eglSwapBuffers without calling
gbm_surface_lock_front_buffer afterward. Fixing that will require more
extensive changes.

egl/gbm : free memory allocated in loadEGLExternalPlatform

libEGL_nvidia.so calls GBM platform (loadEGLExternalPlatform) to register
platform data and unloadEGLExternalPlatform to unregister the same.

==3378==

This change would ensure we free the memory when libEGL would unload GBM
platform library

EGL/GBM: Check the gbm_device in eGbmCreatePlatformWindowSurfaceHook

In eGbmCreatePlatformWindowSurfaceHook, check to make sure that the
gbm_surface came from the same gbm_device as the EGLDisplay. If it's
not, then fail with the error EGL_BAD_NATIVE_WINDOW.

EGL/GBM: Set an error if eGbmCreatePlatformWindowSurfaceHook fails.

If eGbmCreatePlatformWindowSurfaceHook fails, then make sure that we
always set an error code.

In most cases, just set the error to EGL_BAD_ALLOC, since that's the
closest that EGL has to a generic internal error.

EGL-GBM: Use the correct EGLSync type.

In eGbmCreatePlatformWindowSurfaceHook, create an EGLSync of type
EGL_SYNC_FENCE_KHR instead of EGL_SYNC_REUSABLE_KHR.

eglStreamAcquireImageNV and eglStreamReleaseImageNV actually require a
reusable EGL_SYNC_FENCE_KHR sync, not an EGL_SYNC_REUSABLE_KHR sync.

Also fixed eGbmInitializeHook to check for EGL_EXT_sync_reuse instead of
EGL_KHR_reusable_sync.
Add COPYING file, use SPDX License Identifers

Clear dlerror when there is an error

There is code path in eglInitialize that dlsym failure is not fatal,
so dlerror could still return error after eglInitialize succeeded.
Clear dlerror if there is an error.
Don't unlock handles mutex twice in UnrefObjectLocked

Use an EGLSync object to wait for stream frames

When acquiring an eglimage from an EGLStream, an
EGLSync object can be provided to wait for
any pending work work the producer has created
utilizing the image. Create a reusable EGLSync
associated with each gbm_surface EGLSurface, pass
it in when acquiring frames, and immediately wait
for it to idle the surface before handing it off
to the application. This will ensure the surface
is idle until we can add true sync FD/explicit
sync support on desktop GPUs.

Return DRM fourcc format as EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID

Adds a helper function that maps an EGLConfig to
its corresponding DRM format and uses that to
implement the EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID EGLConfig
attribute in both eglGetConfigAttrib() and
eglChooseConfig().

Add EGL_WINDOW_BIT EGLConfigs for gbm_surface

Now that there is support for creating a window
surface from a gbm_surface object + an EGLStream,
expose the EGL_WINDOW_BIT surface type for each
EGLConfig that supports creating an EGLStream
producer surface. The code here was largely based
on similar code in the EGL Wayland external
platform library:

  https://github.com/NVIDIA/egl-wayland

This is not yet entirely accurate. Each EGLConfig
should also likely be inspected to ensure it is
compatible with some GBM format supported by the
GBM device first, and the native visual attribute
should also likely be taken into account (In the
form of a GBM format/drm_fourcc code).

However, this should be enough to start testing
GBM-based EGL applications that render to an
EGLSurface, such as kmscube.

Acquire stream images when they become available

Despite their name, the EGLStream image consumers
events EGL_STREAM_IMAGE_ADD_NV and
EGL_STREAM_IMAGE_AVAILABLE_NV are not actually
events.  Rather, they behave like status bits, and
hence persist until the state they are associated
with changes, rather than until they are read from
an event queue as is the case with
EGL_STREAM_IMAGE_REMOVE_NV and things named events
in most APIs. Hence, to create a sane event loop,
these two events must be processed when they are
received by the platform library, rather than
deferring processing until the application becomes
interested.

This change implements an internal free image
queue which is populated with images that have
been acquired from the EGLStream in response to
EGL_STREAM_IMAGE_AVAILABLE_NV events, but which
have not yet been locked by the GBM application.

Handle EGL_STREAM_IMAGE_REMOVE_NV stream event

When an image is removed from an EGLStream
eglimage consumer, destroy it. If it is currently
locked, defer destruction of its associate GBM
buffer object until it is unlocked.

Handle destroying EGLSurface objects

Hook eglDestroySurface() and attempt to unref the
associated object if there is one. Do not allow
unreferencing the same object twice.

Support creating EGLSurfaces from gbm_surfaces

Plug in the necessary functions for creating EGL
window surfaces from struct gbm_surface objects.
The surfaces are backed by an EGLStream producer
surface with an EGLImage consumer. The stream
will produce images, from which the surface
code will construct and import GBM bo's, which
in turn will be returned to the application when
it calls gbm_surface_lock_front_buffer().

There is currently no cleanup code, so the BOs and
EGL objects are leaked when the surface and
EGLSurface are destroyed.
Use EGL_KHR_display_reference when available

Add EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY handling

If the default device is reqeusted, try to open
the first enumerated DRM device in the system,
create a GBM device from it, and use that as the
default native display.

Note only the first device is attempted. If this
fails, it is better to return failure back up to
GLVND rather than walk all the devices hoping one
succeeds. GLVND can instead potentially try the
request on other EGL implementations, which may
be able to support the first enumerated DRM
device. This will hopefully ensure stable default
device selection regardless of EGL driver vendor
library load order within GLVND.

Implement eGbmIsValidNativeDisplayExport()

Checks the specified nativeDpy to see if it is a
GBM device if possible. Uses mincore to inspect
the object pointed to if possible, and accepts
an environment variable override (EGL_PLATFORM).
If unable to inspect the pointer and no override
is specified, it is assumed the nativeDpy is not
a GBM device.
Add pbuffer surface support
Add EGL error reporting

Add real EGL handle tracking mechanism

Add a tsearch()-based binary tree of valid EGL
handles and a mutex to protect use of it. Man
pages claim the tsearch() family of functions are
thread-safe, but the way it is used here requires
critical sections larger than a single glibc call
unfortunately, so a separate mutex is required.

Find the EGLDevice associated with the GBM device

Rather than returning the first EGLDevice object
found, query the DRM device node paths from each
EGLDevice, looking for one that refers to the same
device as the DRM device FD associated with the
GBM device.

Initialize GBM external platform library project

Contains a minimum viable implementation of a
GBM EGL external platform library. Just enough
code to create and initialize EGLDisplay from a
GBM device.

Many sections of code were cut-and-pasted from the
Wayland EGL external platform project at version &
git tag 1.1.6.
